pr_title: Update non-native base image to ubi8/openjdk-11

timeline.bodyText: Do we have a JDK 11 image? Because we are actively pushing JDK 11 now, this one looks like an oversight.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -126,7 +126,7 @@ We are going to create an OpenShift `build` executing it:
 [source,shell, subs="attributes"]
 ----
 # To build the image on OpenShift
-oc new-app registry.access.redhat.com/redhat-openjdk-18/openjdk18-openshift~{quickstarts-clone-url} --context-dir=getting-started --name=quarkus-quickstart
+oc new-app registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/openjdk-8:latest~{quickstarts-clone-url} --context-dir=getting-started --name=quarkus-quickstart

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's ubi8/openjdk-11:latest. If you'd prefer that in the PR I'll edit it and test accordingly.
replies.author: jmtd

replies.bodyText: tested; Updated to use 11; added signed-off-by; wrapped the commit message (GitHub UI doesn't do that)
replies.author: jmtd

timeline.message:
Update non-native base image to ubi8/openjdk-8

The ubi8/openjdk-8 image, based upon RHEL 8 UBI, is available
legitimately without a Red Hat subscription under the terms of the UBI
EULA. The older (RHEL7-based) image, although it can be pulled
unauthenticated from the Red Hat registry, is not intended to be a
publically available image.

Signed-off-by: Jonathan Dowland <jdowland@redhat.com>

Update non-native base image to ubi8/openjdk-11

The ubi8/openjdk-11 image, based upon RHEL 8 UBI, is available
legitimately without a Red Hat subscription under the terms of the UBI
EULA. The older (RHEL7-based) image, although it can be pulled
unauthenticated from the Red Hat registry, is not intended to be a
publically available image.

Signed-off-by: Jonathan Dowland <jdowland@redhat.com>
